data.title: International Volunteer Organizations
data.meta_description: If you are interested in volunteering internationally, please contact the following organizations: Child Family Health International (CFHI) Child Family Health International (CFHI) runs 20+ Global Health Education Programs in 7 countries placing students in clinics and public health facilities alongside local health professionals. CFHIs 4-16 week experiences immerse students in global health realities in Latin America, Africa, and India. CFHI is an NGO recognized by the United Nations.
data.text:
If you are interested in volunteering internationally, please contact the following organizations:

Child Family Health International (CFHI)

Child Family Health International (CFHI) runs 20+ Global Health Education Programs in 7 countries placing students in clinics and public health facilities alongside local health professionals. CFHIs 4-16 week experiences immerse students in global health realities in Latin America, Africa, and India. CFHI is an NGO recognized by the United Nations.

CURE

CURE is a non-profit organization that operates hospitals and programs in 25 countries worldwide where patients receive surgical treatment regardless of gender, religion, ethnicity or ability to pay.

701 Bosler Avenue

Lemoyne, PA 17043

info@cure.org

Tel: 717-730-6706

Fax: 717-730-6747

Doctors for Global Health

Doctors for Global Health (DGH) is a private, not-for-profit organization promoting health, education, art and other human rights throughout the world. DGH is comprised of hundreds of health professionals, students, educators, artists, attorneys, engineers, retirees and others. Together DGH builds long-term relationships between people and communities around the world to find effective solutions to social justice issues.

P.O. Box 1761

Decatur, GA 30031

dghinfo@dghonline.org

Tel: 1-404-377-3566

Doctors Without Borders (Medicins sans Frontieres)

Doctors Without Borders/Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) is an independent international medical humanitarian organization that delivers emergency aid to people affected by armed conflict, epidemics, natural or manmade disasters or exclusion from health care in more than 70 countries.

333 7th Avenue, 2nd Floor

New York, NY 10001-5004

Tel: 1-212-679-6800

Fax: 1-212-679-7016

Healing Hands for Haiti Foundation, Inc.

Healing Hands for Haiti Foundation provides treatment, physical and occupational rehabilitation and education to the people of Haiti.

P.O. Box 521800

Salt Lake City, Utah 84152-1800

Tel: 1-801-408-5401

Fax: 1-661.885.4441

Health Volunteers Overseas (HVO)

Health Volunteers Overseas (HVO) improves the availability and quality of health care coverage through the education, training and professional development of the health workforce in resource-scarce countries. HVO envisions a world where all people have access to high quality health care delivered by local health professionals.

1900 L Street, NW

Suite 310

Washington DC 20036

Tel: 202-296-0928

info@hvousa.org

Guatemala Healing Hands Foundation

The Guatemala Healing Hands Foundation is a nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the quality and availability of health care in Guatemala through education, surgery and therapy. Specializing in the treatment of congenital and hand injuries, their aim is to reach Guatemalan children and adults through medical missions led by a team of specialized and skilled surgeons, therapists and volunteers.

290 6th Avenue

Brooklyn, NY 11215

mona@guatemalahands.org

Tel: 718-768-5927

Toll-free tel: 866-74-HANDS

International Medical Volunteers Association

The International Medical Volunteers Association (IMVA) is a nonprofit organization that promotes, facilitates, and supports voluntary medical activity through education and information exchange. The IMVA maintains an online list of volunteer-seeking organizations, their needs and details of service.

P.O. Box 205

Woodville, MA. 01784

info@imva.org

Tel: 508-435-7377

Fax. 508 497 9568

Medical Teams International

Medical Teams International is a Christian-based organization that implements and supports programs to address the causes and effects of inadequate health care. Their initiatives include training and education to build the skill and capacity of partners, volunteers, staff and those they serve in order to produce sustainable change. There are not specific hand therapy-related trips, but there may be opportunities for a hand therapist on a medical specialty treatment team. Additionally, there are opportunities for physical and occupational Therapists.

SW Milton Court

Tigard, OR 97224

info@medicalteams.org

Tel: 503-624-1000

Operation Giving Back: American College of Surgeons

Operation Giving Back is a comprehensive resource designed to help surgeons find volunteer opportunities best suited to their expertise and interests, whether across town or across the world. Currently, the database of volunteer opportunities includes detailed information about opportunities for surgeons; however, included in each profile is a space where volunteer agencies can include information on other health care professionals that they need for their missions. This is where any reference to therapists would be included. Depending upon the wording used in the profiles, the generalized search box on the top of the homepage can direct you to such profiles.

633 N. Saint Clair Street

Chicago, IL 60611
